<a id="NoiseTexture3D"></a>

# NoiseTexture3D

**Inherits:** [Texture3D](Texture3D.md) **\<** [Texture](Texture.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A 3D texture filled with noise generated by a [Noise](Noise.md) object.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Uses the [FastNoiseLite](FastNoiseLite.md) library or other noise generators to fill the texture data of your desired size.

The class uses [Thread](Thread.md)\\ s to generate the texture data internally, so [Texture3D.get_data()](Texture3D.md#Texture3D_method_get_data) may return ``null`` if the generation process has not completed yet. In that case, you need to wait for the texture to be generated before accessing the image:

```
    var texture = NoiseTexture3D.new()
    texture.noise = FastNoiseLite.new()
    await texture.changed
    var data = texture.get_data()
```


<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_color_ramp"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Gradient](Gradient.md) **color_ramp** [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_color_ramp)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_color_ramp**\ (\ value\: [Gradient](Gradient.md)\ )
- [Gradient](Gradient.md) **get_color_ramp**\ (\ )

A [Gradient](Gradient.md) which is used to map the luminance of each pixel to a color value.

- [int](int.md) **get_depth**\ (\ )

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_invert"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **invert** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_invert)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_invert**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_invert**\ (\ )

If ``true``, inverts the noise texture. White becomes black, black becomes white.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_noise"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Noise](Noise.md) **noise** [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_noise)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_noise**\ (\ value\: [Noise](Noise.md)\ )
- [Noise](Noise.md) **get_noise**\ (\ )

The instance of the [Noise](Noise.md) object.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_normalize"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **normalize** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_normalize)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_normalize**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_normalized**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the noise image coming from the noise generator is normalized to the range ``0.0`` to ``1.0``.

Turning normalization off can affect the contrast and allows you to generate non repeating tileable noise textures.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_seamless"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **seamless** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_seamless)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_seamless**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_seamless**\ (\ )

If ``true``, a seamless texture is requested from the [Noise](Noise.md) resource.

\ **Note:** Seamless noise textures may take longer to generate and/or can have a lower contrast compared to non-seamless noise depending on the used [Noise](Noise.md) resource. This is because some implementations use higher dimensions for generating seamless noise.

\ **Note:** The default [FastNoiseLite](FastNoiseLite.md) implementation uses the fallback path for seamless generation. If using a [width](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_width), [height](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_height) or [depth](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_depth) lower than the default, you may need to increase [seamless_blend_skirt](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_seamless_blend_skirt) to make seamless blending more effective.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_seamless_blend_skirt"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **seamless_blend_skirt** = `0.1` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_seamless_blend_skirt)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_seamless_blend_skirt**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_seamless_blend_skirt**\ (\ )

Used for the default/fallback implementation of the seamless texture generation. It determines the distance over which the seams are blended. High values may result in less details and contrast. See [Noise](Noise.md) for further details.

\ **Note:** If using a [width](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_width), [height](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_height) or [depth](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_depth) lower than the default, you may need to increase [seamless_blend_skirt](NoiseTexture3D.md#NoiseTexture3D_property_seamless_blend_skirt) to make seamless blending more effective.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="NoiseTexture3D_property_width"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **width** = `64` [ðŸ”—](#NoiseTexture3D_property_width)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- [int](int.md) **get_width**\ (\ )

Width of the generated texture (in pixels).
